cards.name: Cavalcade of Calamity

rulings.text: A creature with power 0 or less can attack, as long as no rule or effect prohibits it from doing so. Many creatures with 0 power have defender, but not all do.

The power of the attacking creature is checked only when the ability triggers. Once it triggers, Cavalcade of Calamity will deal 1 damage to the appropriate player, planeswalker, or Structure even if the creature's power changes or the creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves.

If multiple creatures you control with power 1 or less attack, Cavalcade of Calamity's ability will trigger for each of those creatures. Each ability will cause Cavalcade of Calamity to deal 1 damage to the appropriate player, planeswalker, or Structure.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: Whenever a creature you control with power 1 or less attacks, Cavalcade of Calamity deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure that creature is attacking.

cards.name: Chaos Orb

rulings.text: I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work more reasonably in our games. It is no longer a dexterity card. For the official text and rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chaos Orb: For each nontoken permanent, flip a coin. Then destroy all permanents whose coin came up tails.

cards.name: Drain Life

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, the Structure's stability before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

cards.name: Elvish Bard

rulings.text: I have applied functional errata to this card: it is now a Bard. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

cards.name: Falling Star

rulings.text: I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work more reasonably in our games. It is no longer a dexterity card. For the official text and rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: For each creature on the battlefield, flip a coin. Then Falling Star deals 3 damage to each creature whose coin came up tails. Tap all creatures dealt damage by Falling Star.

cards.name: Hellrider

rulings.text: Creatures you control may attack multiple players, planeswalkers, and/or Structures. For each attacking creature, Hellrider will deal damage to the corresponding player, planeswalker, or Structure.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.

cards.name: Joraga Bard

rulings.text: The ability affects only Allies you control at the time the ability resolves.
I have applied functional errata to this card: it is now a Bard. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: Whenever Joraga Bard or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Ally creatures you control gain vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Mage Slayer

rulings.text: This ability triggers and resolves in the declare attackers step. The creature will still deal its combat damage as normal later on during the combat phase.

When the equipped creature attacks, the first ability will trigger. When that ability resolves, that creature will deal damage equal to its power to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking, even if Mage Slayer has left the battlefield or is equipping a different creature by that time.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, it deals damage equal to its power to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Myr Battlesphere

rulings.text: You choose the value for X as the last ability resolves. You can't choose a value for X that's greater than the number of untapped Myr you control.

You can tap any untapped Myr you control as the last ability resolves, not just the Myr tokens you put onto the battlefield with the first ability. This includes Myr that haven't been under your control since your most recent turn began.

As the last ability resolves, you can tap untapped Myr you control even if Myr Battlesphere is no longer on the battlefield by then. If that has happened, Myr Battlesphere won't be able to get the +X/+0 bonus, but it will still deal X damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
When Myr Battlesphere enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
Whenever Myr Battlesphere attacks, you may tap X untapped Myr you control. If you do, Myr Battlesphere gets +X/+0 until end of turn and deals X damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.

cards.name: Portal Mage

rulings.text: You may cast Portal Mage outside of a declare attackers step. If Portal Mage enters the battlefield outside of a declare attackers step, its ability simply doesn't trigger.
Reselecting which player, planeswalker, or Structure a creature is attacking ignores all requirements, restrictions, and costs associated with attacking.

Reselecting which player, planeswalker, or Structure a creature is attacking doesn't cause "whenever this creature attacks" abilities to trigger. Notably, the Curses in this set (such as Curse of Vitality) won't trigger while Portal Mage's ability is resolving.

If you reselect which player, planeswalker, or Structure an attacking creature is attacking, that creature is still considered to have attacked the player, planeswalker, or Structure as declared, but it is now attacking the new player, planeswalker, or Structure.

If an ability targets something controlled by the "defending player" of an attacking creature and the defending player for that creature changes before that ability resolves, the ability won't resolve because its target has become illegal.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Flash
When Portal Mage enters the battlefield during the declare attackers step, you may reselect which player, planeswalker, or Structure target attacking creature is attacking. (It can't attack its controller or its controller's planeswalkers or Structures.)

cards.name: Raid Bombardment

rulings.text: The power of the attacking creature is checked only when the ability triggers. Once it triggers, Raid Bombardment will deal 1 damage to the appropriate player, planeswalker, or Structure even if the creature's power changes before the ability resolves.
If you attack with multiple creatures with power 2 or less, Raid Bombardment's ability triggers for each of them separately.
A creature with 0 power can attack, as long as it doesn't also have defender.

If the attacking creature leaves the battlefield before Raid Bombardment's triggered ability resolves, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure that creature was attacking before it left the battlefield.

If a creature is attacking a planeswalker or Structure, and that planeswalker or Structure leaves the battlefield, that attacking creature can still be blocked. If it's unblocked, the attacking creature is still attacking. It simply deals no combat damage.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: Whenever a creature you control with power 2 or less attacks, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure that creature is attacking.

cards.name: Rakdos Roustabout

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when a creature becomes blocked triggers only once if two or more creatures block it.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: Whenever Rakdos Roustabout becomes blocked, it deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.

cards.name: Richard Garfield, Ph.D.

rulings.text: As part of the Bracket Cube project, I have applied functional errata to this card to make it work in black-border rules. —Fenhl

When choosing a card name, the card must be legal in the format. In the Bracket Cube format, all cards that were first printed in 2016 or earlier are legal, with the exception of nonstandard cards (planes, phenomena, schemes, vanguards, and conspiracies), ante cards, and uncards other than Richard Garfield, Ph.D.

Casting a spell using Garfield's ability creates a copy effect. The copy effect is applied before any other decisions made during the casting process. It ends once it leaves the battlefield, or moves from the stack to a zone other than the battlefield.

Playing a land using Garfield's ability also creates a copy effect. The card enters the battlefield as a copy of the chosen land card. The choice of which land card, if any, to copy is made as part of playing the land. If no legal choice can be made, the game returns to the moment before the player started to play the land.
A nonland card without a mana cost can be played as a land this way.
You cannot choose the back face of a double-faced or meld card, or the flipped version of a flip card this way.
If you use Garfield's ability on a split card, you must choose a card with a mana cost equal to the combined mana cost of both halves.
If you name a split card using Garfield's ability, the combined mana cost of both halves must be equal to the mana cost of the card you have.

You may cast spells as cards with morph face down by choosing the card name secretly. To secretly choose a card name, write it on a piece of paper and keep it with the face-down card. You can't choose a card name already chosen with Garfield, including one that has been secretly chosen. It must also be the name of a card with a morph ability and the same mana cost as the physical card. Any player who may look at the card may also look at the chosen name. Similarly, if the card is turned face up or revealed (for example because it was countered or died, or you left the game), the chosen name is also revealed.

You can't cast a card as a card with miracle for its miracle cost, because the physical card doesn't have a miracle ability to trigger. If your physical card has miracle, you pay the physical card's miracle cost regardless of as what card you cast it.
If Garfield leaves the battlefield and later returns, the new Garfield has access to all card names again.

Garfield's ability is not Mental Magic. You can name cards that are already on the battlefield, or look up cards using electronic devices. Players are also encouraged to use notes to aid in representing the board state.

cards.text: You may play each card you play as a copy of another card with the same mana cost. You can't choose the same card twice. (Mana cost includes color.)

cards.name: Scorch Spitter

rulings.text: The damage Scorch Spitter deals as its ability resolves isn't combat damage.

If the planeswalker or Structure Scorch Spitter is attacking is reduced to 0 loyalty or stability from the damage caused by its ability, Scorch Spitter continues to attack. It can be blocked, and it won't deal any combat damage if it's not blocked.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: Whenever Scorch Spitter attacks, it deals 1 damage to the player, planeswalker, or Structure it's attacking.

cards.name: Soul Burn

rulings.text: Will give 1 life for each black mana used, but not more life than the amount of unprevented damage that is dealt.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, the Structure's stability before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

cards.name: Tahngarth, First Mate

rulings.text: Players can't take any actions between the time you choose to give control of Tahngarth to the attacking player and the time it becomes an attacking creature.
If Tahngarth gains menace, it can't be blocked at all.
Giving control of Tahngarth to an opponent doesn't cause it to become untapped. This means that Tahngarth may end up attacking several times between your turns.
If an opponent is attacking a planeswalker or Structure but not that permanent's controller, Tahngarth can't attack that player.

If an opponent attacks a player, planeswalker, or Strucure but each creature attacking that permanent or player is no longer attacking that permanent or player by the time Tahngarth's ability resolves (most likely because they've left the battlefield), that permanent or player can't be chosen for Tahngarth to attack. If there's no player, planeswalker, or Structure to choose this way but you still choose to give the opponent control of Tahngarth, Tahngarth isn't attacking.

Although Tahngarth is an attacking creature if it uses its triggered ability, it was never declared as an attacking creature. This means that abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks won't trigger when it changes control and becomes attacking.

Any effects that say that Tahngarth can't attack or can't attack a certain player (such as that of Propaganda, or if Tahngarth gains defender) affect only the declaration of attackers. They won't stop Tahngarth from becoming an attacking creature through its triggered ability.
Tahngarth may end up attacking its owner this way.

Commander damage is tracked for each commander. It doesn't matter who controls the commander as it deals damage. If Tahngarth deals 10 damage to one player while under your control and another 11 damage to that same player while under a third player's control, the player loses the game.
I have applied functional errata to this card in order to make it work with Structures from Ruins of Doharum. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text:
Tahngarth, First Mate can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Whenever an opponent attacks with one or more creatures, if Tahngarth is tapped, you may have that opponent gain control of Tahngarth until end of combat. If you do, choose a player, planeswalker, or Structure that opponent is attacking. Tahngarth is attacking that permanent or player.

cards.name: Yisan, the Wanderer Bard

rulings.text: If Yisan isn't on the battlefield when its ability resolves, use the number of verse counters on it when it left the battlefield to determine which creature cards may be put onto the battlefield. This number will include the counter you put on Yisan to activate the ability.
I have applied functional errata to this card: it is now a Bard. For the official text and new rulings, please look up the card on Gatherer. —Fenhl

cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}, Put a verse counter on Yisan, the Wanderer Bard: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of verse counters on Yisan, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
